update.description:
Trying to break this up into nice, review-able chunks.

The networking peer tracker is the bottom layer for the distributed simulation to detect and track available peers.

This is used by higher-level functionality to determine when it is okay to execute simulation.

Updated to test the use of ign-transport partitions to separate multiple instances of distributed simulation on the same subnet.
update.title: [A-3] Networking PeerTracker

content.raw: Approving this, but if it's not a deep rabbit hole, it would be interesting to check what's going on on OSX. @azeey recently spent some time cleaning that up so it would be nice to keep it as clean as possible.
content.html: Approving this, but if it's not a deep rabbit hole, it would be interesting to check what's going on on OSX. @azeey recently spent some time cleaning that up so it would be nice to keep it as clean as possible.

content.raw: This is an artifact of clang-tidy not actually running a build, just the cmake.  Those files are generated as part of the `make` invocation, so they don’t exist at this point yet.  It looks like we’ll have to run enough of a build to get those generated.
content.html: This is an artifact of clang-tidy not actually running a build, just the cmake. Those files are generated as part of the make invocation, so they don’t exist at this point yet. It looks like we’ll have to run enough of a build to get those generated.

content.raw:
`clang-tidy` doesn't like this:

~~~
/home/developer/ign-gazebo/src/network/PeerInfo.hh:26:10: error: 'msgs/peer_info.pb.h' file not found [clang-diagnostic-error]
#include "msgs/peer_info.pb.h"
~~~

I know these messages are meant for internal consumption, but I just wanted to make sure we won't need to install these message files so other tools can use them. Or maybe installing would be a bad idea? If we do install them, maybe this include can become `<ignition/gazebo/networking/peer_info.pb.h>`.
content.html:
clang-tidy doesn't like this:

/home/developer/ign-gazebo/src/network/PeerInfo.hh:26:10: error: 'msgs/peer_info.pb.h' file not found [clang-diagnostic-error]
#include "msgs/peer_info.pb.h"

I know these messages are meant for internal consumption, but I just wanted to make sure we won't need to install these message files so other tools can use them. Or maybe installing would be a bad idea? If we do install them, maybe this include can become <ignition/gazebo/networking/peer_info.pb.h>.

content.raw: I think `Connect()` and `Disconnect()` are not implemented, the declarations can be removed
content.html: I think Connect() and Disconnect() are not implemented, the declarations can be removed

content.raw: `ign-msgs` handles this by injecting #pragmas into the generated code.  Since I’m not currently using that generator, I opted to disable the warnings for those generated source files.
content.html: ign-msgs handles this by injecting #pragmas into the generated code. Since I’m not currently using that generator, I opted to disable the warnings for those generated source files.

content.raw:
Why is a `shared_ptr` being used here? Do we expect someone else to be using this info?

I was also wondering if we expect trackers to connect -> disconnect -> re-connect with different info. If not, I'd consider doing the connection / disconnection on constructor / destructor.
content.html:
Why is a shared_ptr being used here? Do we expect someone else to be using this info?

I was also wondering if we expect trackers to connect -> disconnect -> re-connect with different info. If not, I'd consider doing the connection / disconnection on constructor / destructor.

content.raw: I have some minor suggestions on pull request #136
content.html: I have some minor suggestions on pull request #136

content.raw: I believe that ign-msgs handles this somehow, I’ll try and copy that functionality.
content.html: I believe that ign-msgs handles this somehow, I’ll try and copy that functionality.

content.raw:
We're getting some warnings from protobuf's generated code, I wonder if there's a way for us to turn it off

~~~
/home/developer/ign-gazebo/build/src/msgs/peer_info.pb.cc: In member function 'virtual google::protobuf::uint8* ignition::gazebo::msgs::PeerInfo::InternalSerializeWithCachedSiz
esToArray(bool, google::protobuf::uint8*) const':                                                                                                                               
/home/developer/ign-gazebo/build/src/msgs/peer_info.pb.cc:389:10: warning: unused parameter 'deterministic' [-Wunused-parameter]                                                
     bool deterministic, ::google::protobuf::uint8* target) const {                                                                                                             
     ~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~~~~  
~~~
content.html:
We're getting some warnings from protobuf's generated code, I wonder if there's a way for us to turn it off

/home/developer/ign-gazebo/build/src/msgs/peer_info.pb.cc: In member function 'virtual google::protobuf::uint8* ignition::gazebo::msgs::PeerInfo::InternalSerializeWithCachedSiz
esToArray(bool, google::protobuf::uint8*) const':                                                                                                                               
/home/developer/ign-gazebo/build/src/msgs/peer_info.pb.cc:389:10: warning: unused parameter 'deterministic' [-Wunused-parameter]                                                
     bool deterministic, ::google::protobuf::uint8* target) const {                                                                                                             
     ~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~~~~
